intro: Phanera saigonensis var. poilanei, commonly known as the Saigon phanera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
